definition[0]: the past tense and past participle of bind
definition[1]: a bound book is covered on the outside with paper, leather etc
example[0]: a leather-bound volume of Shakespeareâ€™s plays
definition[2]: to run with a lot of energy, because you are happy, excited, or frightened
example[2]: Suddenly a huge dog came bounding towards me.
definition[3]: a long or high jump made with a lot of energy
definition[4]: if someone is bound by a law, promise, or agreement, they have to do what it says
example[3]: He is still bound by his contract with the record label.
example[4]: The developer is legally bound to abide by the conditions in the planning permission.
example[5]: The company was bound by law to provide electricity to all homes in the area.
